Title: MCT BE Automation PCS Engineer
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob Description As a Backend Manufacturing Central Teams Process Control Systems (PCS) Engineer, you will be responsible for developing, maintaining and improving Fault Detection and Classification (FDC) and Run To Run (R2R) process control strategies at our manufacturing facilities across backend operations. You will work with global teams to provide direction and assistance with process control functions.  You will help to coordinate and implement process control systems across multiple international facilities that reduce scrap, prevent excursions, and improve process margins and yields, thereby reducing manufacturing costs.  It is highly desirable that the applicant has experience implementing and maintaining FDC and R2R control solutions in semiconductor manufacturing operations.  Experience in using machine learning and statistical techniques to create state-of-the-art data products (decision support and decision automation data systems), utilizing extensive and diverse Big Data sets is a plus. Responsibilities and Tasks (include, but not limited to): •Develop and integrate new FDC and R2R control algorithms into backend manufacturing process areas •Implement standards and business processes for FDC and R2R Control Systems for backend semiconductor manufacturing: •Identify dependencies for FDC and R2R control solutions •Implement, maintain and improve established standards •Test and implement control system changes and improvements •Measure manufacturing sites’ performance and compliance to company standards and industry benchmarks •Manage the implementation of controlled modifications using Change Management methodologies, from network support and direction drive perspective. Support the manufacturing sites on: •Deployment and on-going maintenance of FDC strategies (data collection, statistical models, limits, out of control actions, etc.) in an effort to minimize risks of excursion, and product scrap •Troubleshoot strategy/tool/system related issues, including proper documentation, escalation, and follow-up to completion •Monitor strategy performance and effectiveness and identify opportunities for improvement •Identify and implement FDC and R2R strategy best known methods (BKM) for excursion/scrap prevention. Review and align control strategies and procedures with global sites PCS counterparts •Engage with global stakeholders to explore, analyze and promote the use of FDC data •Work with Information Technology (IT) and Global Manufacturing Teams and Suppliers to drive improvements in data collection and automation capabilities, including tool feedback and control •Understand and Maintain System Dependencies •Evaluate and monitor user lists for program access in compliance with established product integrity, security, and intellectual property rights’ protection standards •Facilitate FDC and R2R global projects and activities •Coordinate FDC and R2R tasks and activities involving integration to various backend software and automation systems •Project Planning •Act as a liaison between Information Technology, production area management, and engineering management in matters concerning FDC and R2R •Anticipate or diagnose automation issues across multiple equipment types within a given manufacturing area •Define and deploy projects that have impact on a global scale •Organize and execute project plans efficiently and effectively •Cost Reduction  •As a Team Member, you are responsible for reducing costs associated with your area. This responsibility may include owning and completing cost reduction projects, identifying cost effective sustaining/manufacturing improvements, minimizing regular expenditures, and helping to promote a cost-conscious culture •Ensure that effective requirements, standards and procedures exist for functional areas and sites to accomplish given manufacturing operations •Provide direction on the facilitation of the practical application of FDC and R2R within Backend Manufacturing environment •Work with global teams such as Global Quality, Site Quality teams, Manufacturing Central Teams, and IT to assess the compliance of functional areas and sites to global standards •Ensure all business needs are properly documented, validated, and escalated as needed •Analyze findings and assess potential problems and risks within functional areas and sites •Compile and issue formal reports detailing findings, potential problems, recommend solutions •Follow up on action items to ensure solutions/corrective actions are implemented •Ensure process control solutions and corrective actions are aligned throughout the backend manufacturing ne •Ensure BKM sharing and alignment spans across all functional areas and sites regardless of technology and/or site mission differences •Facilitate and maintain world class data analysis skill sets and tools for engineering efficiency to support data driven decisions by engineers •Provide tactical support to the manufacturing sites as required for issues of yield and quality, working with other peer groups Program Management: •Able to multitask and adapt to changing priorities •Demonstrate ability to move projects effectively through project lifecycle – initiate, plan, execute, and close – while balancing time, cost, quality, scope and risk / opportunity constraints •Motivate stakeholders and all project team members to take ownership of project and its success •Direct and coordinate the activities of others to accomplish project tasks successfully •Prioritize and manage multiple conflicting projects based on backend and corporate objectives •Lead cross-functional initiatives and enable projects that support company objectives •Develop and implement metrics for benchmarking Performance.  Identify and share BKMs across departments and sites and track compliance in aligning to BKM’s   Communication:  •Communicate and respond to issues in a timely manner •Use active listening skills to effectively communicate with other team members •Express ideas and issues in an organized, effective, and respectful manner •Use voice, tone, and body language to enhance communication •Written communication is complete, concise, grammatically correct, and appropriate for the audience •Invite feedback for clarification and self-improvement •Demonstrate cultural sensitivity - Show respect for different cultures and languages; learn to pronounce names correctly; speak English slowly and clearly when interacting with non-native English speakers; invite feedback to ensure others understand •Use conference call etiquette and enforce during all meetings •Be an active participant in all group discussions, meetings, etc… (internal and external) •Flexible and accommodating but willing to voice opinions and make recommendations
Requirements: RequirementsEducation Required •Minimum B.S. degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, or related Engineering degree   Experience Required •Minimum 3 years of experience in semiconductor industry applying a variety of statistical methods, including process control and/or metrology •Experience in developing and management of FDC and/or R2R control solutions in semiconductor manufacturing •Experience with R, JMP, and/or other statistical software including scripting capability for automating analyses

Everyone has a voice at Xaxis, and we are open to new ways of thinking, especially those that will contribute to the overall success of Xaxis. Collect, prepare, consolidated and analyse yearly budgets, quarterly forecasts and monthly actuals for all APAC markets First point of contact for global reporting team for day to day queries Collection of information and preparation of monthly billing, revenue and net sales analysis, and various financial and management reports Work closely with global and local reporting teams to ensure Title: Research Fellow
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Delta-NTU Corporate Laboratory for Cyber-Physical Systems was jointly established by the School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering (EEE) at Nanyang Technological University (NTU) and Delta Electronics. The Corp Lab aims to create business value through collaborative commercialization of translational research and industrial development.  Successful candidates will conduct research and development work related to Smart Manufacturing. The candidates are expected to contribute in effort targets pave new solution business in Smart Manufacturing in the Asia Pacific Region. Established in 1981, the SCHOOL OF ELECTRICAL AND ELECTRONIC ENGINEERING (EEE) http://www.eee.ntu.edu.sg is one of the founding Schools of the Nanyang Technological University. Built on a culture of excellence, the School is renowned for its high academic standards and research. With more than 150 faculty members and an enrolment of more than 4,000, of which about 1,000 are graduate students, it is one of the largest EEE schools in the world and ranks 6th in the field of Electrical & Electronic Engineering in the 2017 QS World University Rankings by Subjects. Delta Electronics was founded in 1971 and is a global leader in Power Electronics, Energy Management and Smart Green Life, with over 50 R&D sites globally and more than 5,000 R&D engineers. Job description: You will be responsible for developing natural language processing (NLP)/natural language understanding (NLU) technologies to support key application areas in the context of team-based learning. The overall scope of the project involves the deployment of distributed microphones that communicate to each other. Received signals will then be converted to text for further analysis (using NLP). Together with a team, the initial job scope includes the review of next generation cyber physical system (CPS) devices for group-based discussion, survey of the latest off-the-shelf devices available for such applications, drafting a possible architecture to link up these devices, setting up of a prototype demonstration system using existing algorithms and evaluation of the portability of the algorithms to smartphones. As a research fellow in this position, you will be responsible for the analysis of the speech-to-text signals and developing next generation NLP/NLU technologies. Job Requirements:  PhD degree in Electrical/Electronics/Computer Engineering/Computer Science; Experience in natural language processing, machine learning, data analytics; Proficient in Python, C/C++; Excellent publication records in top-tier journals; Able to work independently and willing to co-operate with existing team members; Fluent in both verbal and written English; Highly motivated and able to commit the whole period of the project  Application Procedure: Interested candidates please send your CV/resume to: Assoc. Prof. Andy Khong School of Electrical & Electronic Engineering Nanyang Technological University 50 Nanyang Avenue Block S2.1 Singapore 639798  E-mail Address for E-mailed Applications: andykhong@ntu.edu.sg Electronic submission of application is highly encouraged. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified for interview.
Requirements: RequirementsAs above

Title: Research Officer in Machine Learning and Computational Biology (BMDD) /  BII (A*STAR)
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAbout the Bioinformatics Institute (BII)  The Bioinformatics Institute (BII) is an institute of the Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR). BII was set up in July 2001 as part of the national initiative to foster and advance biomedical research and human capital for a vibrant knowledge-based Singapore. With a multi-disciplinary focus and collaborative outlook, BII recognises the need for depth and breadth in all its activities for building a thriving world-class biomedical research, graduate training and development hub in Singapore. In addition, BII is proactively involved in building a national resource centre in bioinformatics to meet the evolving needs of the scientific community in Singapore.   For more information about A*STAR and BII , please visit www.a-star.edu.sg and  and www.bii.a-star.edu.sg respectively.   A Research Officer position in the areas of machine learning and computational biology is immediately available in the Machine Learning for Bioimage Analysis Group (http://web.bii.a-star.edu.sg/~chengli) and Structure-based Ligand Discovery and Design Group (https://web.bii.a-star.edu.sg/~fanh) at Bioinformatics Institute (BII), Agency for Science and Technology Research (A*STAR). The Cheng lab focuses on developing novel machine learning methods to address biodata analysis problems. The Fan lab focuses on developing novel structural modeling methods to study the interactions between biomolecules and small molecule ligands.  Responsibilities  The successful candidate will help in developing machine learning techniques with a focus on addressing structural biology problems. The candidate has the opportunity to work in a highly interdisciplinary and stimulating environment.
Requirements: Requirements BSc in computer science and engineering, or related disciplines. Strong programming skill. Background knowledge of machine learning will be a big plus. Prior knowledge in structural biology is not required however it is important to have an Interest in biological sciences. ​Strong problem-solving skills, and able to work independently  ​ The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Title: Research Fellow Position in Data Science and Analytics for Buildings
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAn unprecedented explosion of sensor and spatial data are being generated in the building industry. The Internet-of-Things (IoT) and building and energy management systems (BMS/EMS) are commonplace in modern commercial buildings, while building information models (BIM) capture geometric and meta data from the design phase. These temporal and spatial data are highly underutilized. Through their heterogeneity, buildings defy traditional analytics and diagnostics techniques and human ad-hoc analysis is unavoidable.  A research fellow position is available to focus on extraction of typical performance patterns from non-residential buildings and the development of visual analytics tools to showcase their implementation.   To apply, please submit a cover letter specifying your research interests and experience, your curriculum vitae, a link to your ResearchGate, Github, and StackOverﬂow proﬁles to: Dr. ClaytonMiller(clayton@nus.edu.sg)
Requirements: Requirements2. Skills: Skills in building performance analysis or simulation are required. Data analysis proﬁciency using open source tools such as Python, Pandas, R, Jupyter, and Github is highly desired. Some proﬁciency in web technologies such as JavaScript and d3.js is required. 3. Experience: Desiredcandidatesshouldbefamiliarwiththebuildingandconstructionindustry through previous experience in design, project management or analysis of buildings. The position will require experience in temporal data analysis tasks such as supervised model development, unsupervised clustering analysis, and interpretation of results. 4. Qualiﬁcations: The candidate should hold or be nearing completion of at least a Ph.D. degree with a focus in Computer/Data Science, Engineering, or Architecture. Two or more years of practical experience in the building industry is also desired.

Title: Product Marketing Manager, Strategy and Insights, YouTube - Singapore
Address: MARINA BAY FINANCIAL CENTRE, 8 MARINA BOULEVARD 018981
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesCompany overview: Google is not a conventional company, and we don’t intend to become one. True, we share attributes with the world’s most successful organizations – a focus on innovation and smart business practices comes to mind – but even as we continue to grow, we’re committed to retaining a small-company feel. At Google, we know that every employee has something important to say, and that every employee is integral to our success. We provide individually-tailored compensation packages that can be comprised of competitive salary, bonus, and equity components, along with the opportunity to earn further financial bonuses and rewards. Googlers thrive in small, focused teams and high-energy environments, believe in the ability of technology to change the world, and are as passionate about their lives as they are about their work. For more information, visit www.google.com/careers. The area: Marketing Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems--from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can--changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself. The role: Product Marketing Manager, Strategy and Insights, YouTube - Singapore Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end. Additional Role Description: YouTube Subscriptions - our subscription services for music experiences, great original shows and unplugged TV - is one of the fastest growing areas of YouTube and a key priority for the company. You will be part of a fast-moving entrepreneurial team while capitalizing on our global platform.  In this role, your focus will be Marketing Strategy and Analytics for the YouTube Music Subscriptions business. You'll identify high-impact opportunities to increase user acquisition, engagement, and retention in the business. You will be a champion for data-focused growth in marketing efforts, and ensure that product and marketing teams are empowered with the data and insights they need. You'll work with the YouTube Subscriptions Marketing team as well as cross-functional stakeholders from product management, engineering and data science. This role is at the centre of developing our marketing strategy and measuring the efficiency and impact of our work across the subscriptions business. Responsibilities: - Use data to proactively identify opportunities to increase user acquisition and user engagement. Identify and quantify critical risks to reaching short and long term goals. - Advocate for consistent, measurable, incremental growth. Formulate recommendations on marketing and product strategy decisions. - Design experiments to test new features, and conduct quantitative data analysis of experiment results. - Understand, explain and track marketing performance. - Help set long-term and quarterly OKRs for the business.
Requirements: RequirementsMinimum qualifications: - BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience. - 5 years of marketing experience. Preferred qualifications: - MBA or Master's degree, or equivalent practical experience - Experience in market research using a variety of research techniques (e.g., ethnography, focus groups, IDIs, segmentation, messaging, position, tracking, etc.) and data sets. - Experience working with stakeholders to influence decision making. - Demonstrated problem solving and analysis skills and impeccable business judgment. Capacity for developing and understanding strategy. - Effective project management skills and attention to detail, with the ability to motivate a large team to work together across functional product ownership areas. - Demonstrated written and oral communication skills.

Title: Regional Hardware Retail Marketing Manager, Google Pixel - Singapore
Address: MARINA BAY FINANCIAL CENTRE, 8 MARINA BOULEVARD 018981
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesCompany overview: Google is not a conventional company, and we don’t intend to become one. True, we share attributes with the world’s most successful organizations – a focus on innovation and smart business practices comes to mind – but even as we continue to grow, we’re committed to retaining a small-company feel. At Google, we know that every employee has something important to say, and that every employee is integral to our success. We provide individually-tailored compensation packages that can be comprised of competitive salary, bonus, and equity components, along with the opportunity to earn further financial bonuses and rewards. Googlers thrive in small, focused teams and high-energy environments, believe in the ability of technology to change the world, and are as passionate about their lives as they are about their work. For more information, visit www.google.com/careers. The area: Marketing Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems--from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can--changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself. The role: Regional Hardware Retail Marketing Manager, Google Pixel - Singapore Whether you're on a consumer product (like Gmail, Search, Maps, Chrome, Android) or a business product (AdWords, AdSense, DoubleClick, Analytics), you take part in a complete marketing experience as you lead every facet of the product's journey. From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you work with a cross-functional team across sales, corporate communications, legal, webmasters, product development, engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with product marketing strategy from beginning to end. Additional Role Description: The Google Marketing team is responsible for marketing the company's product portfolio to end users, partners and customers worldwide. Within Google Marketing, Retail Marketing is tasked with bringing the best of Google innovation to users in partners’ retail spaces. The team is developing new in-store designs, shopper experiences, and technologies to showcase the best of Google services, as well as Google-branded hardware. We work across global, regional and local Google teams in a fast start-up like environment, and in partnership with retailers, operators, and other channel partners, to bring our shared vision to life.  As a Regional Hardware Retail Marketing Manager, you are a fully dedicated business leader, shaping the future of one of our many Google hardware products From determining positioning, naming, competitive analysis, feature prioritization and external communications, you help shape the voice of the product and help it grow a loyal consumer base. This means you'll work with a cross-functional team across Sales, Corporate Communications, Legal, Webmasters, Product Development, Engineering and more. In this role, you'll be involved with end-to-end product retail marketing strategy. Responsibilities: - Be the voice of users in APAC to global teams, showcasing the unique needs of this region and leading retail innovations that can best serve the needs of the region. - Lead retail Go-to-Market planning for new and existing Google hardware products with marketers across the entire APAC region and get involved in partner engagement, messaging development across the in-store journey, in-store visibility and training programs. - Work cross-functionally with retail operations, product, sales, and product marketing teams to align on product roadmap, prioritization, execution planning and performance tracking. - Lead localization of global design assets and provide creative support to both internal and external retail partners. - Initiate and execute new retail marketing programs at scale.
Requirements: RequirementsMinimum qualifications: - BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience. - 6 years of experience working in a hardware or retail company as a trade/retail marketing manager, account manager, channel marketing, or consumer marketing role. - Experience working with cross-functional teams. Preferred qualifications: - Demonstrated passion for retail and creating customer experiences. - Ability to operate in a fast-paced environment and to work on multiple projects simultaneously in a dynamic and constantly evolving context. - Demonstrated ability to develop strategy and business plans and effectively influence external partners. - Demonstrated problem solving skills with a high degree of analytical rigor. - Effective leadership and written and oral communication skills.

Title: Data Scientist
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesData Scientist We are currently seeking applications from an experienced Data Scientist to join our Healthcare Informatics (HI) team based in our Connexis office Singapore.  At ResMed we focus on capability and passion. With your in-depth knowledge and understanding in applied research and development in the areas of data science biomedical informatics, you will use the latest technologies in machine learning and distributed computing. The platform and algorithms developed may be used in a range of diagnostic and therapeutic applications, such as sleep disorder breathing, chronic obstructive pulmonary disorder, and other respiratory disorders, as well as co-morbidities such as congestive heart failure and diabetes and chronic disease management. The candidate we are seeking will specialise in the following areas and be capable of the following responsibilities: • Research, customization, and development of statistical and machine learning algorithms to meet project requirements; tasks include defining hypotheses, executing necessary tests and experiments, evaluating, tuning and optimizing algorithms and methods to specific situations. • Analysis of big data for data-driven solution validation, evaluation and technology innovation.   • Optimize data analysis processes and systems for better efficiency and maintainability.   • Writing of documents that clearly explain how algorithms should be implemented, verified and validated. • Writing documents for use in the preparation of intellectual property and technical publications. • Monitoring the literature of interest and industrial development trends, broadly in the areas of data analysis and machine learning. • Understanding regulatory requirements, such as those mandated by the FDA. • Working within the ResMed Quality system, standards and maintaining training requirements.
Requirements: RequirementsLet’s talk about you: To really get us excited, you will have extensive working knowledge of machine learning fundamental theories and data mining technologies with proficiency in statistical analysis methods, including analysis of variance, regression, time series analysis, survival analysis, etc. In addition, you will have strong database skills and experience, including experience with SQL programming. You will also have a Post-graduate research experience (Masters or PhD) Degree in a field encompassing Data Science, Applied Statistics, or Biomedical Informatics or related discipline with experience in relevant data science industry. Experience in a medical device company would also be advantageous. Let’s talk about the team: Big ideas and big goals reign at ResMed Singapore. Within this growing HI team, you’ll thrive in an environment filled with self-starters who possess the drive to make a difference. You’ll be encouraged within a people-focused culture that motivates and recognises talent, so that together, we can produce the best products and results. OK, so what next? At ResMed, we believe in supporting, inspiring and developing our people. So we recruit the best and then give them the tools to make a real difference in the lives of our patients. We believe that fresh thinking inspires innovation – and our shared success. If this sounds like a place you would like to work and you have the drive to transform and enhance the lives of millions of patients through your contribution at work, then today is your day! Apply now!

Title: Associate Director – Marketing Effectiveness
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAssociate Director – Marketing Effectiveness  Nielsen N.V. (NYSE: NLSN) is a global performance management company that provides a comprehensive understanding of what consumers Watch and Buy. Nielsen’s Watch segment provides media and advertising clients with Total Audience measurement services across all devices where content — video, audio and text — is consumed. The Buy segment offers consumer packaged goods manufacturers and retailers the industry’s only global view of retail performance measurement. By integrating information from its Watch and Buy segments and other data sources, Nielsen provides its clients with both world-class measurement as well as analytics that help improve performance. Nielsen, an S&P 500 company, has operations in over 100 countries that cover more than 90 percent of the world’s population. For more information, visit www.nielsen.com.   THE JOB BRIEF  This role belongs to Marketing Effectiveness practice which identify the optimal path to improve effectiveness of clients' marketing strategy/activities via advanced analytical solutions.   The mission of this role is to help our clients identify their business opportunities or solve their business issues, by proposing optimal analytical solutions and delivering the analysis with actionable business insights, based on deep understanding of client needs and robust analytical expertise across varied Nielsen solutions. Once a project is commissioned, the individual in this role will collaborate with internal modeling hub on most solutions, translating client needs into detailed analytical requirements for the modeling hub, and drawing/reporting actionable business insights out of the modeling/analytics outcome to meet clients' business needs. Through this, this role will build client satisfactions, leading to sustainable revenue for Nielsen.   To achieve this mission, the individual will be responsible for:   [BUSINESS MANAGEMENT RESPONSIBILITY]   Responsible for managing client accounts across multiple industries for markets within South East Asia and North Asia, to meet financial objective and other operational performance indicators Able to function as the primary point of contact of Marketing Effectiveness practice, externally for senior level client marketing and research teams, and internally for other Nielsen departments Ensure effective and efficient use of the team s/he leads, including appropriate allocation of financial target/projects to respective team members, and providing necessary support/training for them to meet expectations. Manage team members’ professional development, ranging from hands-on training to a large audience and building individual development plans for direct reports  [ANALYSIS DELIVERY RESPONSIBILITY]   Responsible for leading analysis projects and ensuring all study deliverables across versatile Marketing Effectiveness solutions meet client needs with actionable insights in a timely manner, as well as company's quality standards. This includes:   Full analytical mastery of versatile Marketing Effectiveness solutions, and technical mastery by collaborating with internal solution experts/modeling hub Translate client needs into study design and detailed analytical requirements, for flawless briefing to the modeling hub Guide the modeling hub to ensure timely modeling execution following Nielsen quality standards Interpret modeling outcomes from the hub with actionable business insights to fully meet client needs and company's quality standards Develop and present analysis reports to clients’ senior management team, including C-level personnel Answer inquiries from clients on the analysis outcome Help clients implement indicated actions from the analysis  [SALES RESPONSIBILITY]   Liaise with Client Servicing teams, ensure adequate supply of business prospects, by continuous market scoping initiatives and proposals of optimal analytical solutions to promising clients, as a representative of Marketing Effectiveness practice, independently for the assigned scope, or sometimes under a supervision of a senior manager. This includes:   Full commercial competency of core Marketing Effectiveness solutions, and technical expertise by collaborating with internal solution experts, to select/customize optimal solutions to meet client needs Plan and strategize on yearly revenue targets on the accounts s/he is holding Collaborate with team members to identify areas of opportunities in industries/companies outside our BAU Timely and deep understanding of client needs Develop and present proposals to clients Close the deals with necessary negotiations.  [OTHER ORGANIZATIONAL RESPONSIBILITY]   Build team capability, efficient work process and good culture to lead to a high performance team Translates company’s strategy into objectives and action plans; aligned across teams, functions and business units
Requirements: Requirements DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE BA/BS in numerate discipline required 9+ years work experience in a similar role(s) Robust logical/analytical thinking Strong problem-solving capability, sometimes through out-of-box thinking Excellent communication skills, can articulate concepts simply and concisely to the point Strong mindset on accountability, results oriented; one who takes initiatives & follow-through Robust statistical knowledge Strong Excel and PowerPoint skills. Able to convert ideas into powerful visualizations & charts

Title: FUSION Cyber Analytics Production Engineering Associate
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesCompany Profile Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. The Firm?s 55,000 employees, located in 1,200 offices across 43 countries, serve clients including corporations, governments and individuals. As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values rooted in integrity, excellence, a strong team ethic and giving back to our communities. Morgan Stanley provides a superior foundation for building a professional career - a place for people to learn, achieve and grow. A philosophy that balances personal lifestyles, perspectives and needs is an important part of our culture.  Division & Department Profile The mission of the Global Technology division is to provide a highly reliable and commercial technology platform, which supports the Firm?s strategy, delivered by an innovative, world-class team of professionals. Technology & Information Risk (TIR) is part of the Global Technology organization and manages operational and technology related risks on behalf of the Firm. TIR's mandate is to enable the Firm to manage its technology and data related risks through implementing proactive, comprehensive and consistent risk management practices across the Firm to protect the franchise while capturing business opportunities. The TIR team partners with the business by ensuring that Technology and Data understands how to manage escalate and monitor risk. Morgan Stanley?s state-of-the-art Cybersecurity Fusion Center (Fusion) is charged with orchestrating prevention, detection, and response to cyber events that threaten the Firm?s clients, assets, and reputation. Partnering with key stakeholders across Enterprise Technology & Risk and the Business Units, Fusion manages cyber events from detection through response to resolution, and serves as the Firm?s focal point for cyber communications and reporting. Fusing together information received externally from our partners and internally from our detection and analytics teams to enable rapid decision-making, Fusion is the cornerstone of the Firm?s agile and adaptive cyber defense strategy - enabling the Firm to rapidly align our defensive capabilities to adapt to changing adversary tactics.  Team Profile The global Cyber Analytics team plays a critical role in the ability of the Fusion Center to detect the threats against the Morgan Stanley network. Our Singapore Cyber Analytics team members will contribute to the delivery of a suite of advanced external and internal monitoring capabilities to enable real time threat detection delivered to incident response teams, as well as customized dashboards featured on a Fusion Centers Ops Walls. These Walls providing situational awareness of the Firm?s technology assets, applications, and security controls to enable cyber teams to quickly detect any evidence of anomalous activity. We are currently building our Singapore Fusion team, to become an integral part of our follow the sun global team delivering state of the art cyber analytics capabilities. With access to a deep bench of experts globally ? this team will bring and build industry leading and cross industry applicable solutions to cyber security threats and response capabilities, further enhancing the region?s profile as a leader in the cybersecurity innovation field within financial services and beyond.  Role Description/ Primary Responsibilities The Cyber Analytics team requires a Production Engineering Developer to participate in developing and productionizing cutting edge cyber analytics external and internal monitoring and display capabilities. We are seeking a motivated self-starter with a blend of security and computer science skills to work across functional teams with the ultimate goal of producing innovative capabilities that measurably improve Morgan Stanley's cybersecurity posture and real-time awareness. The ideal candidate is an inquisitive learner with a passion for security, data and analytics. The candidate must effectively collaborate with stakeholders from inception to completion of a capability, and should be able to simultaneously lead an end-to-end effort as well as participate in the execution of solutions within the overall effort. This role requires a mixture of cybersecurity acumen and technical expertise, along with an ability to build strong partnerships across functions  The global Fusion Center is a 24/7 operation with members in key geographical locations. The developer in this position will statically work weekday core hours, but could be asked for support on evenings or weekends in the event that an incident or potential threat necessitates extraordinary and immediate action.  Primary Functions:  Problem definition, data exploration, data acquisition and visualization, evaluating and comparing metrics, deploying various models and iteratively improving solutions; Leverage machine learning within analytics development.  Data Analytics Development ? Develop specific, cutting edge analytics to monitor, detect and report of malicious activity for systems most critical to business success  Engage with stakeholders to identify data efficiency requirements Work with customers and learn their challenges such that efficient resolution of requirements is achieved Be a strong team player and communicator who is able to participate in a team-oriented, fast-paced environment  Develop continuous improvements with Fusion Center teams to push the organization towards new and improved ways to use data to improve our protective posture.
Requirements: RequirementsSkills Required   5+ years of experience  Proficient in Python and multiple programming languages  Education in Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Mining, Analytics, Data Science or other quantitative disciplines  Demonstrated aptitude and understanding of modern programming languages with a willingness to continually learn  new languages and data structures  Experience orchestrating end-to-end solutions; simultaneously working closely with programmers, analysts, and customers  Knowledge of a range of computer security issues, with depth in at least one or two functional areas. Strong analytical, and data analysis skills  Ability to distil technical and complex information into easy to understand business terms for management  Skills desired  Existing knowledge of data analysis tools including Splunk, Hadoop and Cloudera International experience or experience working for a global organization Willingness to learn about the technology and cyber threat environment General understanding of Cyber security practices

Title: Equities: Officer / AVP, Equities Data and Analytics Software Developer, Global Markets Technology
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAbout Bank of America Merrill Lynch:  Our purpose as a firm is to make financial lives better, through the power of every connection. Across the world, we partner with leading corporate and institutional investors through our offices in more than 40 countries. In the U.S alone, we serve almost all Fortune 500 companies and approximately 59 million consumers and small-business customers. We provide a full suite of financial products and services, from banking and investments to asset and risk management. We cover a broad range of asset classes, making us a global leader in corporate and investment banking, sales and trading.                              Connecting Asia Pacific to the World Our Asia Pacific team is spread across 23 offices in 12 markets. We are focused on connecting Asia to the world and the world to Asia, using our global expertise to ensure success is shared between us, our clients and our communities. Our regional footprint covers 12 currencies, more than a dozen languages and five time zones, placing us firmly among the region’s leading financial services companies. Bank of America Merrill Lynch is committed to attracting, recruiting and retaining top diverse talent from across the globe. Our diversity and inclusion mission is to actively promote an inclusive work environment where all employees have the opportunity to achieve personal success and contribute to the growth of our business. Each of our global Employee Networks bring together employees, create dialogue and awareness in support of our Diversity and Inclusion mission. Bank of America Merrill Lynch is an equal opportunities employer. Position Description Background: The Equities Trading Data and Analytics (DNA) team is part of the wider Equity Technology team and specifically aligned with the Electronic Trading Technology and High-touch & Portfolio Trading Technology teams. The teams develop and maintain software for the Equities Trading business in the Global Markets and Investment Banking Group, providing innovative solutions which include client connectivity, low latency market access, smart order routing, algorithmic trading, workflow, internal crossing, analytics and reporting, all of which rely on highly available real-time and historical data. The tech teams work very closely with the Equities business, especially the quant teams working on algo development, the sales teams developing the product and coverage and onboarding teams managing the technical and reporting relationships with clients. Equity trading, especially electronic trading, depends on high volume, high quality data. This includes inputs such as historical market data, real-time monitoring and analytics for consumption by trading systems, users and clients, and reporting at end of day or across large historical data ranges. Sophisticated quantitative analysis of trading performance drives improvement of the existing electronic trading platform and innovation in new product offerings. The Equities Trading Data and Analytics (DNA) team develops and maintains high-throughput, high-availability systems for real-time capture, distribution and retention of vast amounts of market data and order and execution data, across the whole of BAML’s Equities Trading business.  The APAC team is based in Singapore and services clients in, primarily, HK and Japan, but also trading operations in India, Taiwan, Australia and Singapore, amongst others.  The team ensures the smooth running of the plant and the availability and distribution of data, reports and analytics. Each of the Equities tech teams are global teams with a strong presence in every region. We aim to maintain a global perspective while recognizing and responding to specific regional requirements that make each market unique.  Our Singapore Equities IT team is a diverse, dynamic and technically demanding team of around 50 people, including architects, developers and QA specialists. The team is responsible for the entire Equities Trading product set in Asia and enjoys a strong and close relationship with the Equity Trading management and business in Hong Kong.  The team maintains a strong, collaborative developer culture with frequent technical and business knowledge-sharing events. Project Background The data platform providing these services is a complex mix of technologies, requiring sophisticated software development and design approaches. The technical landscape also includes a new generation of open source and proprietary technologies that allow greater developer productivity, higher performance and better returns on hardware costs. The DNA team is continually investing to strengthen and maintain the existing platform (KDB+/Q, Java) and is well advanced in a globally-led project to replace the data capture, distribution and warehousing with new generation data technologies (including Apache STORM, Kafka), configured to operate as a real-time event-processing pipeline.  Success requires working with development, traders, quants, support and infrastructure teams to deliver a high quality, end to end solution. The team typically work across the whole set of systems, including the data warehouse, the tick data plant, analytics reporting and real-time alerting and the new real-time event processing platform. The team are responsible for the whole SDLC, including analysis with traders, sales and other IT teams, development and testing and integration into the trading stack. Second-level support is provided by the team who act as SMEs to the support teams. The team also act as data SMEs to trading, sales and quants performing complex analyses not otherwise available through the reporting suite. Key Responsibilities We require a very technical, full-stack, collaborative, hands-on developer who is aware of the project environment and can show initiative, deliver business value and think seriously about the design of the platform. The successful applicant will be enthusiastic about data as a subject and its applications and techniques.  Work within the global team, the local team and individually to develop and extend our systems for performance, coverage and new functionality. Work with technology and business groups in the region and globally to deliver high quality products in a fast-paced environment. Communicate and discuss with Business Owners on specifications, testing and sign-off. Partner with support functions to provide support, advice and remediation of issues. Contribute to the technical excellence of our platforms by performing code reviews, writing and performing tests and documentation as part of the SDLC process. Work collaboratively with our business partners to generate and analyze large data sets and provide technical advice and expertise in the production or analysis of these data sets.
Requirements: RequirementsKey Requirements Essential Skills:  Design skills and programming experience on high performance systems in either Java or KDB+/Q, with a full-stack mentality. Strong analytical skills are required to provide solutions for complex business requirements. Possess a mindset of constant innovation & ownership of quality via automation & tools. A team mentality is essential.  Must be able to work with and mentor junior members as well as take direction from seniors. Good communication skills and the ability to coordinate different tasks and work with different stakeholder groups from business, through development to infrastructure and support. Big data knowledge including real time stream processing, analytics and large data stores. Experience working within a project team. Finance knowledge, with equity front office desirable.  Nice-to-have:  Understanding of Agile methodology, test driven development & continuous integration. Java, KDB+/Q, SQL, real-time streaming and distributed programming. GIT/SVN, Automated deployment, CI, automated testing, scripting, Linux admin. Electronic trading or Equities business knowledge will be an advantage.

Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Digital Marketing Specialist is responsible for developing and executing strategies for digital marketing efforts to create revenue-driving programs that build relationship with our partners, parents, as well as on-line audiences through the use of various digital and social media platforms.  You should have a strong grasp of current marketing tools and strategies and be able to lead integrated digital marketing campaigns from concept to execution.  This position involves working at both the strategic and operational level and provide direct hand-on contributions within our team.  Campaign scopes include digital marketing, search marketing (SEM), SEO, retargeting, social (e.g. Leads on Facebook and other channels), Affiliate marketing, email marketing, and any other advertising.  Additionally, this person will assist with content distribution (organic traffic that comes from articles, newsletter, videos, etc.) and helping distribution strategy/analytics such as website, social channels such as Facebook and Twitter, email marketing management and comprehensive Google Analytics service. The specialist will also gain comprehensive experience working within including manage different international competitions from conception through completion. The new hire can expect to work closely with the management team to help develop targeted, segmented customer acquisition program and to optimize channels to increase ROI and develop marketing program with our country partners and parents.  15% Online marketing strategy 50% Online marketing execution 15% Analytics and reporting 20% Event management  Responsibilities:  Create, manage and execute all aspects of digital marketing to increase engagement, reach, impression and conversions. Create content for digital channels including: Social media, blogs, press release, newsletters, website, etc. Develop, execute and monitor digital advertising for lead generation, brand awareness and increase conversions. Assist in design, execution, maintenance and reporting of marketing campaigns. Research and manage new/existing social media and communication platforms for external and internal use. Monitor, analyse and report digital marketing impact, insights & metrics consistently reviewing and improving to drive engagement. Assist with SEO and SEM covering PPC and retargeting campaign including related analytics/reporting. Help teaching company employees how to effectively use Social media & other communication tools. Event planning, design and production while managing all project delivery elements within time limits Liaise with partners and management team to identify their needs and to ensure customer satisfaction Conduct market research, gather information and negotiate contracts prior to closing any deals Reach out to sponsorship on behalf of our organization Organize facilities and manage all event’s details such as tours, coordination with restaurants, decor, catering, entertainment, transportation, location, invitee list, special guests, equipment, promotional material etc. with the event company Ensure compliance with insurance, legal, health and safety obligations Work closely with the Marketing team to promote and publicize event Proactively handle any arising issues and troubleshoot any emerging problems on the event day Conduct pre- and post – event evaluations and report on outcomes
Requirements: Requirements Fresh graduates from Poly/University are welcome.  Must be keen to learn. Crazy in all areas of Digital marketing and is familiar with the latest platforms and trends. Creative, multi-tasking self-starter with excellent communication and time management skills. Ability to execute email marketing best practices and testing techniques. Well verse in content creation with excellent written communication skills. Knowledge in SEO/SEM/PPC.  Google AdWords, Google Analytics and other related Google tools. Layout, landing page design and Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator experience beneficial. Web development skills using WordPress. Ability to brainstorm and contribute to a high-performance team environment. Detailed-oriented and deadline driven. Excellent work ethic & positive, can-do attitude. Energetic, outgoing and team player.  For more information, please visit www.simcc.org ~ Acquire industry knowledge ~ Apply basic negotiation skills and techniques ~ Apply principles of revenue management ~ Conduct market research ~ Contribute to marketing campaigns and solutions ~ Documenting project processes and outcomes ~ Establish relationships to build customer confidence ~ Facilitate effective communication and engagement at the workplace ~ Facilitate work teams to perform effectively ~ Implement process improvement change ~ Implement sustainable operations using green initiatives ~ Maintain personal image and emotional competence to manage self and team at the workplace ~ Manage online information ~ Monitor guest/customer experience ~ Monitor social media platforms ~ Monitor workplace safety and security ~ Perform online collaboration ~ Prepare sales and marketing collaterals ~ Role model the service vision ~ Write reports

Title: IT Software Engineer
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAre you an experienced mainframe engineer with all-round skills? Would you enjoy helping us to modernize a legacy application landscape? Can you imagine yourself working as part of a multi-location team? If so, we’re looking for someone like you to: – determine solutions to IT business requirements and assist in implementing them – demonstrate expertise both in technical design and issue management – use your all-round experience to build and maintain mainframe software – conduct requirements-gathering activities, like evaluating services, using a variety of internal and external data and conducting end user interviews – support the business/client representatives by describing the system processes, both in the system design phase and issue debugging – assist in quality control The expected start date for the role is Nov 2018.   You’ll be working in the Reference Data Services delivery team in Singapore, partnering with a similar team located in Zurich, Switzerland. Our role is to provide business applications (customers) with a global infrastructure for the management, maintenance and use of reference static data. Our clients are the business application owners and the data owners of reference data tables. We provide customers with tools and public services for maintaining, managing and using shared reference data, backed up by our own dedicated support organization. We offer standardization, central storage and global synchronization for master and control data, ensuring high data quality and enabling programming to be parameterized and structured more flexibly.
Requirements: RequirementsYou have: – long-standing experience designing and building complex applications with relational databases – solid experience in COBOL and z/OS programming, IBM Tivoli Workload Scheduler, CICS transactions, network databases; experience in tools like Dynarep, TOAD for DB2, SDLC Modelling Platform suite of tools – hands-on experience in Changeman facilitated software delivery and good knowledge of SQL, JCL and IBM Debugger You are: – able to keep the pace in delivering business value while working in a sustainable environment – able to improve older code bases, as well as apply modern best practices to new projects – curious and collaborative, comfortable working independently, as well as in a team – an excellent communicator who can partner with technical experts as well as end-users who might not be well versed in IT (you’re comfortable talking to pros and amateurs)

Title: Fraud Investigation & Dispute Services (FIDS) Senior Manager, Assurance Services, Singapore
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesJoin Fraud Investigation & Dispute Services (FIDS) within Assurance and you will help clients work through complex issues of fraud, regulatory compliance and business disputes. You will be part of a multidisciplinary, culturally aligned team that works with clients and their legal advisors.   The opportunity You will experience ongoing professional development through diverse experiences, world-class learning and individually tailored coaching. That’s how we develop outstanding leaders who team to deliver on our promises to all of our stakeholders, and in so doing, play a critical role in building a better working world for our people, for our clients and for our communities. Sound interesting? Well this is just the beginning. Because whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.   Skills and attributes for success  Work on client engagement teams in carrying out both reactive and proactive forensic analysis of large amounts of structured and unstructured data involving a wide range of database management software, statistical and predictive machine learning software, and link analysis and data visualization software. Involve in project activities including data collection and load, data quality assessment, data cleansing and enhancing, complex data transformation, relationship profiling, sampling and extrapolation, segmentation, statistical modelling, segmentation, structured data mining, text mining and analytical matching. Work in our specialist forensic technology data analytics lab and on site to help clients leverage knowledge from their data for measurement of fraud risks and losses, prevention, continuous monitoring, detection and investigation of occupational fraud, waste and abuse, financial crime and other form non-compliant activities. Work with clients, fraud examiners, internal and external auditors, lawyers and regulatory authorities in sometimes sensitive and adversarial situations. Help to prepare sections of expert reports, including review, analysis and verification of evidence data and identifying key issues. Be willing to learn, and with time develop and improve leading edge methodologies applied to forensic data analytics engagement that are both reactive and proactive.
Requirements: RequirementsTo qualify for the role you must have  Strong academic record with a degree in a relevant field At least eight years of experience in auditing, forensic accounting, investigation or litigation support. Candidates with compliance experience within Life Science industry is encouraged to apply Ability to run forensic assignments across multiple jurisdictions Experience in case management and managing portfolio of clients A team player with an investigative mindset Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Excellent command of spoken and written English Traveling expected    What we look for We’re interested in leaders with a genuine creative vision and the confidence to make it happen. You can expect plenty of autonomy in this role, so you’ll also need the ability to take initiative and seek out opportunities to improve our current relationships and processes. If you’re serious about forensic investigations and ready to take on some of our clients’ most complex issues, this role is for you.   What working at EY offers EY offers a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. We are committed to being an inclusive employer and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. Plus, we offer:  Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you    About EY As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible. Join us in building a better working world. Apply now.

Title: Research Fellow (1-year contract), Living Analytics Research Centre
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesCOMPANY DESCRIPTION Singapore Management University is a place where high-level professionalism blends together with a healthy informality. The ''family-like'' atmosphere among the SMU community fosters a culture where employees work, plan, organise and play together – building a strong collegiality and morale within the university.  Our commitment to attract and retain talent is ongoing. We offer attractive benefits and welfare, competitive compensation packages, and generous professional development opportunities – all to meet the work-life needs of our staff. No wonder, then, that SMU continues to be given numerous awards and recognition for its human resource excellence.   RESPONSIBILITIES The Living Analytics Research Centre (LARC) is a joint research initiative between Singapore Management University (SMU) and Carnegie Mellon University (CMU) that focuses on behavioural and social network analytics in the fields of Urban and Community Liveability, Personalised Urban Mobility, Jobs and Skills Intelligence, as well as Smart Consumption and Healthy Lifestyle. In line with Singapore’s Smart Nation goal, one of LARC’s objectives will be to harness technology to its fullest potential with the aim of improving the lives of Citizens and creating more opportunities. Candidates who join us can also expect to gain a deeper knowledge in the following areas: Big Data Analytics, Data Mining, Machine Learning, Deep Learning and other relevant disciplines. The Research Fellow will work with faculty researchers on one or more of the following research topics in the urban/social computing, smart cities and consumer business domains.  Data and Text Mining Machine Learning Deep Learning Crowdsourcing Recommender Systems Social-Urban Sensing Big Data Infrastructure    The Research Fellow will also be responsible for one or more the following:  Designing research methodologies Developing algorithms and models Conducting data science studies Designing and conducting experiments Designing and implementing applications, tools and systems Developing analytics capabilities in big data infrastructure
Requirements: Requirements PhD in Computer Science and related disciplines Good knowledge in relevant research topics and research skills Proficient in at least one or more of these programming languages: Java, Python, C#, C++ and C

Title: Manager - Data Analytics, Advisory
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesBusiness has always wanted to derive insights from information to make better, smarter, real time, fact-based decisions: it is this demand for depth of knowledge that has fueled the growth of big data tools and platforms.  Our clients are increasingly looking to us to provide simple, innovative and effective approaches and processes by leveraging on cutting-edge data analytical tools and techniques. Join us as a Manager and you’ll play a key role in making that happen across multiple industries worldwide.   The opportunity  To extract value from big data, it must be processed and analyzed in a timely manner, and the results need to be available in a way that can effect positive change or influence business decisions. So whether you’re interested in data engineering, advanced analytics, data warehousing or visualization, we have a role for you. Whichever you choose, you can expect to work in a truly leading-edge environment, surrounded by some of the most engaging and knowledgeable colleagues in the business.   Your key responsibilities  This is a role where no two days are the same – so you’ll find yourself taking on plenty of new responsibilities as you go. You’ll work alongside clients and colleagues, balancing your time between developing security strategies, advising stakeholders, providing workshops and supporting business development. If you’re flexible and ready to adapt to a constantly changing environment, there’s no better place to develop your skills. Since you’ll be working directly with clients, some travel will be required.    Skills and attributes for success  Working on client engagement managing teams and carrying out both reactive and proactive analysis of large amounts of structured and unstructured data involving a wide range of advanced data analysis technology, database management software. Working with clients to explore and implement the best data-warehousing strategy to solve their business problems. Leading small and/or large teams on site to help clients leverage knowledge from their data for revenue generation, measurement and/or performance improvement purposes. Educating clients and key stakeholders on the benefits of data analysis and how it can be applied to their solve business issues continuously.
Requirements: RequirementsTo qualify for the role you must have  Bachelor's degree in a numerate discipline e.g. Information Management, Business Intelligence, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science with a strong computer programming component At least 8 years of working experience in consulting, analytics software-as-a-service or technology industry. Must have proven hands-on experience in the use of MSSQL, Teradata, Hadoop, Informatica PowerCenter 9.x,IBM Datastage 8.7,OWB 10.2,Informatica Data Quality,Informatica PWX tools Strong experience in data warehousing and development, especially ETL (Extract-Transform-Load). Exposure to all stage of data analytics project lifecycle (identification, extraction, load, transform/shape, analyze, report) both from a design and implementation perspective Demonstrable understanding of data quality risks and ability to carry out necessary quality checks to validate results obtained Familiar with ERP systems such as SAP, Microsoft Dynamics, Oracle, or PeopleSoft Articulate, with excellent oral and written communication skills Adaptable, able to interact and build strong relationships with people from a diverse range of backgrounds Intellectually rigorous, with strong analytical skills and a passion for data Sound logical reasoning and deep thinking ability Ability to work accurately to a high level of detail Travelling is required  Ideally, you’ll also have  Other data analysis / visualization platform (e.g. SQL, SAS, R, Tableau, Qlikview, SPSS) would be preferred skills Experience with big data analytics platforms such as Spark or Rapidminer would be an advantage Well-organized with experience of project management    What we look for We’re interested in flexible professionals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritise shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. You’ll also need the confidence to give professional advice and guidance to colleagues and clients from a diverse range of cultures, often with limited information – both verbally and in writing. If you’re a fast learner, with strong influencing skills and a genuine passion for information system security, this role is for you.  What working at EY offers EY offers a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. We are committed to being an inclusive employer and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. Plus, we offer:  Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you    About EY As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we’re using the finance products, expertise and systems we’ve developed to build a better working world. That starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. Whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. And with a commitment to hiring and developing the most passionate people, we’ll make our ambition to be the best employer by 2020 a reality.   If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.   Join us in building a better working world. Apply now.

SBIZ currently has more than 4,000 students enrolled in various degree programmes.   Our students are mainly working adults who are keen to upgrade and remain competitive in the fast-paced business world. We also have a sizable group of full-time students pursuing their degree education full time in the University. To equip our students for a better future, we provide them with a curriculum that is industry-relevant and we adopt innovative and practice-oriented pedagogical approaches (e.g. case study, flipped-classroom). Classes are interactive in nature and instructors go beyond lectures and facilitate interactive discussions and activities that require application of theories to solve real world problems. As most of our students are working, they are able to apply what they have learnt in the classroom to real-life scenarios in their workplace almost immediately. This enables them to live out our maxim - Learn Today, Apply Tomorrow.   SBIZ is now recruiting passionate full-time faculty members who are aligned with our education aspirations. The responsibilities of SBIZ full-time faculty members include teaching and developing courses, conducting academic and/or applied research, and managing degree programmes and projects. We are interested in candidates in the following areas:    Accountancy (especially in the areas of Financial Accounting, Managerial Accounting, Assurance, Taxation, Business Valuation and Accounting Theory)  Analytics (especially in the areas of Machine Learning, Data Mining, Text Mining, Statistics, Forecasting, Optimisation, Data Visualisation, Data Management, IoT and Big Data) Business Law Entrepreneurship  Finance Information Systems Project Management Quality Management Supply Chain Management (especially in the areas of Procurement and International Trade  System) Strategy Operations Management Customer Relationship Management Business excellence (especially in the area of SPRING Singapore's Business Excellence framework)
Requirements: Requirements Ph.D. degree holder in a relevant discipline. Ph.D candidates nearing completion will also be considered. Candidate with teaching and/or working experience in the relevant area will have an added advantage. In the area of Finance, candidates with a Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) qualification or those in the area of Fintech, crytocurrency and digital banking will have an added advantage. In the area of Accountancy, candidates with a Chartered Accountant of Singapore qualification (or equivalent professional qualification) and at least a Master's degree in a relevant area will also be considered.  In the area of Business Law, candidates with a Bachelor's degree in Law and at least 5 years of relevant working experience will also be considered.    For more information and application, please visit our website: http://www.suss.edu.sg/careers/appointments-vacancies/Pages/Academic-Appointments-(Full-time).aspx (Only shortlisted candidates will be notified)

This approach is particularly successful for managing requirements and functional tests on large-scale projects of significant domain and organisational complexity. Specification by example is also known as example-driven development, executable requirements, acceptance test–driven development (ATDD[2] or A-TDD[3]), Agile Acceptance Testing,[4] Test-Driven Requirements (TDR).

Title: Display Go to Market Lead, APAC - Singapore
Address: MARINA BAY FINANCIAL CENTRE, 8 MARINA BOULEVARD 018981
Responsibility: Roles & ResponsibilitiesCompany overview: Google is not a conventional company, and we don’t intend to become one. True, we share attributes with the world’s most successful organizations – a focus on innovation and smart business practices comes to mind – but even as we continue to grow, we’re committed to retaining a small-company feel. At Google, we know that every employee has something important to say, and that every employee is integral to our success. We provide individually-tailored compensation packages that can be comprised of competitive salary, bonus, and equity components, along with the opportunity to earn further financial bonuses and rewards. Googlers thrive in small, focused teams and high-energy environments, believe in the ability of technology to change the world, and are as passionate about their lives as they are about their work. For more information, visit www.google.com/careers. The area: Sales Operations The Go-to-Market Operations (GtM) team ensures Google's complex and ever-evolving Ads business runs smoothly. We are instrumental in setting go-to-market strategy, and ensuring flawless execution and operations against the strategy. We have teams embedded in each of the major Ads business areas as well as global teams that work across the business areas. Team members are analytical and strategic, with a pragmatic sense of how to get things done. The role: Display Go to Market Lead, APAC - Singapore Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users. The Go to Market organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with strong day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.  The Go to Market organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with strong day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives. Responsibilities:  Create, execute, and refine the APAC Go-to-Market strategy for Display products Drive adoption of key products by influencing and equipping sales specialists, sales communities, and pods across the organization, identifying additional points of leverage across Large Customer Sales (LCS). Identify gaps in products and build business cases based on advertiser needs. Partner with Global Product Leads on the product roadmap.
Requirements: RequirementsMinimum qualifications:  BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience. 6 year of experience in the digital marketing field, with strong knowledge of the Display Advertising industry Distinctive problem-solving and analysis skills, combined with strong business judgment and excellent written and oral communication skills Strong collaboration skills, ability to work across multiple teams in delivering complex initiatives successfully, and the ability to thrive in ambiguity  Preferred qualifications:  MBA or graduate degree in a management or technical field Demonstrated passion for product development with the ability to juggle multiple work-streams in a fast-paced environment while paying close attention to detail Previous experience in Media, AdTech, Agency or Consulting firm Strong knowledge about Google AdWords Display products Previous experience working in or with Asia-Pacific markets or another emerging market Experience of working with DoubleClick Digital Marketing suite is a plus
